Articles.Content:
KSP Version: 1.2.2, Steam version.

OS: Windows 10 32-bit

What happens: Whenever I launch the game, it starts loading all parts as usual, but as soon as the loading finishes, (i.e. Says it's complete), the game crashes, and I get the standard windows message "Program is not responding". I am not even able to see the menu before the game crashes to desktop. For some reason I also have an error log.

Mods / Add-ons: All Stock.

DxDiag: http://pastebin.com/iujXRSW7

Error Log: http://pastebin.com/jcLLDLC1

Output Log: http://pastebin.com/SkAghW6H

Hi @Trojan3268, it looks like you are running out of memory for KSP, only 2gb can be allocated to a single program on 32bit Windows.

Is upgrading to Windows 10 64bit an option for you? Your CPU is 64bit so can support it.

If not, try using the KSP launcher to lower the graphics settings, particularly the texture quality as textures use a lot of memory.

Thanks for the fast response @sal_vager!

Unfortunately, I have no idea how to update to 64-bit version of windows, so it seems like that option is not viable.

Will post here as soon as the problem is fixed, as well as the solution for me!
It looks like upgrading is not as direct as I thought, and there's more required than just a 64bit cpu, plus you'd need to backup your data.

Hmmm... I'll try fixing it with the launcher option, by lowering the graphic settings tomorrow morning. If that does not work, I'll try contacting support!

Thanks for your time and help sal_vager!
